Frequently Asked Questions

The following are some frequently asked questions about web sign-on:

How Do I Change My Password?

The "Manage Your Account" link allows you to change your password, challenge questions and challenge response answers. You can change these at any time.

Can I Change My User ID?

No. In our continued pursuit of Operational Excellence, we have been striving to offer employees a simple and convenient way to access company and personal information electronically. As the amount of information available to SW employees expands with new web services, it becomes increasingly important to keep this information secure, yet simple for employees to access. To accomplish this task and provide the most convenient experience for our employees, SW issues all employees a standard User ID for logging into company web sites.

What Is A Challenge Question And Response?

Challenge Questions are special questions that you must answer during the New Account Process (as a first time user). The answer you provide, your Challenge Response, will be used as a confirmation if you ever need to reset your password. It is important for you to remember which Challenge Question and the corresponding Challenge Response you select during the registration process. You are the only source for the data you provide. It is only used to reset your password in the event it is forgotten. Please do not share your Challenge Answer and Challenge Response with peers or family members.

Can I Change My Challenge Question Or Response?

Yes, Click the "Manage Your Account" link.

What Is A Timeout?

All secured web sites have a timeout setting. This means your web session will become invalid after a certain period of inactivity. This is a security precaution so that your account cannot be used if you are away from your computer for a period of time. Depending upon the security of the information presented on each website, the timeout settings will vary. Highly-sensitive websites typically timeout after 15 minutes of inactivity.

Who Can I Call For Help?

Our Global Service Desk is available to all employees 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. Please contact our Global Service Desk at +1 (216) 566-2997, Option #1. For those having problems creating their accounts for the first time, or if you forgot your User ID, please contact your Direct Manager prior to calling the Global Service Desk.

I Am A New Employee And The System Does Not Recognize Me.

Occasionally, your personal information may not be entered into our HR system before you start working. Please contact your Direct Manager, if you are unable to establish your identity; or, you can wait and try again in 24-48 hours.

I Forgot My Password.

Click the "Forgot Password" link. You will be asked to identify yourself, similar to how you did during New Account Creation. Our Global Service Desk is available to all employees 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year by calling +1 (216) 566-2997, Option #1.

I Forgot My User ID.

If you have forgotten your User ID, please contact your direct manager.

More Questions?

We encourage your comments and questions. Please submit via the MySherwin Feedback, or send to mysherwin@sherwin.com.

Can I use the Mobile Authenticator on more than one mobile device?

Currently, only one mobile device may use the Mobile Authenticator app. If you would like to use more than one device, you can choose to have your verification code sent via SMS.

Can I log into company systems from off the network?

It is against company policy to permit anyone to access any company system from off the network, unless

Is my personal information secured or is it shared with anyone?

The information you provide will only be used for the purposes of user authentication and identity verification in some circumstances when accessing company systems, such as when accessing certain systems from outside the company network, or to verify your identity for company password resets. Your information will be secured in accordance with the company's Employee Privacy Policy available on mySherwin or from Human Resources. If opting-in for personal mobile, standard text message charges may apply from your wireless provider, depending on your text message plan.

What is MFA?

Multi-factor authentication (MFA) provides additional protection during logon to Company systems. Access to systems protected by MFA requires both a password and a verification code. The code will be provided to employees through the contact method selected during registration/opt-in. Example contact methods include a mobile phone that can receive texts or an email address. Company mobile phone numbers and company email addresses are acceptable contact methods, in addition to personal emails and mobile numbers.

How do I clear the "Remember Me" option if I would like to utilize a Verification Code again?

Clearing the browser's cookies will ensure you will be prompted to utilize your Verification Code the next time you log in. Refer to your browser's Help Menu for the steps to clear cookies.

Having trouble? Visit our FAQ section
